name: GetOrder2
description:
Retrieves order details by searching a specific order ID.

>If you wish to retrieve unmasked data, use the `reason` parameter.

> The `View order` resource is needed to use this API request. This is included in `OMS - Full access` and `IntegrationProfile - Fulfillment Oms`, among other default roles available in the Admin. Learn more about the [License manager roles and resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/roles--7HKK5Uau2H6wxE1rH5oRbc#).

> Check the new [Orders onboarding guide](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/orders-overview). We created this guide to improve the onboarding experience for developers at VTEX. It assembles all documentation on our Developer Portal about Orders and is organized by focusing on the developer's journey.

> Throttling: Each account can make up to 5000 requests per minute.

## Request object has the following properties:

| Attribute    | Type        | Description |
| --------------- |:---------:| --------------------------------------:|
| `orderId` | string | Order Id |


## Response object has the following properties:


| Attribute    | Type        | Description |
| --------------- |:---------:| --------------------------------------:|
| `affiliateId` | string | Seller Name who was responsible for the order |
| `allowCancellation` | boolean | If Cancellation is allowed |
| `allowEdition` | boolean | If Order Edition is allowed |
| `approvedBy` | string | User who approved the order |
| `authorizedDate` | string | Authorized Order Date |
| `callCenterOperatorData` | string | Call Center Operator responsible for the order |
| `cancelReason` | string | Cancel Reason |
| `cancelledBy` | string | User who Cancelled the order |

Content-Type.description: Type of the content being sent.

Accept.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

$ul: **affiliateId**: Three letter code identifying the marketplace where the order was placed.
**allowCancellation**: Indicates whether cancelation is allowed for the order.
**allowEdition**: Indicates whether edition is allowed for the order.
**approvedBy**: User that approved the order, in case of manual approval.
**authorizedDate**: Date in which the order was authorized in UTC.
**changesData**: Array with data on order changes.
**corporateDocument**: Company document, in case client is corporate.
**corporateName**: Company name, in case client is corporate.
**corporatePhone**: Company telephone number, in case client is corporate.
**stateInscription**: Company state inscription, in case client is corporate.
**tradeName**: Company trade name, in case client is corporate.
**invoiceData**: Information pertinent to the order's invoice.
**invoicedDate**: Date in which the order was invoiced in UTC.
**isCheckedIn**: Indicates whether client is checked in.
**items**: Information on each item in the order.
**marketplaceOrderId**: ID of the order in the marketplace.
**marketplaceServicesEndpoint**: Marketplace endpoint for post purchase communication.
**orderFormId**: ID of the shopping cart from which the order was created.
**transactions**: Array with information on each transaction of the order.
**rateAndBenefitsIdentifiers**: Array with rates and benefits IDs.
**logisticsInfo**: Array with logistics information of each item in the order.
**selectedAddresses**: Array of the selected addresses' information.
**statusDescription**: Status description which is displayed on the Admin panel.
**StartsWithCurrencySymbol**: Indicates whether value representations start with currency symbol.
**totals**: Information on each of the order's totals.
